# Growth `stan` lognormal

**Using `Stan` with a lognormal likelihood.**

We used the following growth model with a lognormal distribution to estimate individual growth potential in `stan`:

\begin{equation} 
  DBH_{y=today,s,i}  - DBH_{y=y0,s,i} \sim \\
  \mathcal{logN} (log(\sum _{y=y_0} ^{y=today} \theta_{1,s}.exp(-\frac12.[\frac{log(\frac{DBH_{y,s,i}}{100.\theta_{2,s}})}{\theta_{3,s}}]^2)), \sigma_1) \\ 
  \theta_{2,s}  = e^{log(\theta_2) + \sigma_3.\epsilon_{2,s}} \\ 
  \theta_{3,s}  = e^{log(\theta_3) + \sigma_4.\epsilon_{3,s}} \\  
  \epsilon_{1,i} \sim \mathcal{N}(0,1) \\
  \epsilon_{2,p} \sim \mathcal{N}(0,1) \\
  \epsilon_{3,p} \sim \mathcal{N}(0,1) \\
  ~ \\
  (\theta_{1,p}, \theta_2, \theta_3) \sim \mathcal{logN}^3(log(1),1) \\ 
  (\sigma_1, \sigma_2, \sigma_3, \sigma_4) \sim \mathcal{N}^4_T(0,1) \\ 
  ~ \\
  \theta_{1,s,i} = e^{log(\theta_{1,s}) + \sigma_2.\epsilon_{1,i}} \\ 
    (\#eq:gmax1)
\end{equation} 

```{r samplinga, eval=F}
load("save/mdata.Rdata")
model <- stan_model("model/gmax.stan")
fit <- sampling(model, chains = 2, data = mdata, save_warmup = F, control = list(adapt_delta = 0.99, max_treedepth = 12),
                include = F, pars = c("epsilon_s2", "epsilon_s3", "epsilon_i", "DBH"))
save(data, mdata, fit, file = "model/gmax.Rdata"))
```

```{r fita}
load("model/gmax.Rdata")
```

```{r timea}
get_elapsed_time(fit) %>% 
  as.data.frame() %>% 
  rownames_to_column("chain") %>% 
  mutate(total = warmup + sample) %>% 
  mutate_at(c("warmup", "sample", "total"), lubridate::seconds_to_period) %>% 
  kable(caption = "Elapsed time to fit 187 trees over 37 years and 3 species in the plot 14 of Paracou.")
```

```{r traceplota}
mcmc_trace(fit, pars = c("thetai1[1]", "thetas1[1]", "sigma", "lp__"), np = nuts_params(fit))
```

```{r pairsa}
mcmc_pairs(fit, pars = c("thetai1[1]", "thetas1[1]", "sigma"), np = nuts_params(fit))
```

```{r thetasa}
mcmc_intervals(fit, pars = paste0("thetas1[", 1:mdata$S, "]"))
```

```{r thetaia}

```
